Posts.Content: soriya123 wrote: Hello, I am new here.  Since english is not my first language please forgive me.  Found my lump on my right breast toward upper outer quadrant two weeks ago. NO close relatives with breast cancer history.  My Dr said not to worry because cancer feel hard like a rock, mine is not.  Dr Sheduled me to get mommogram a week after, Radiogist/doctor said my lump is kinda hidden so hard form him to see on a mammogram.  So he did an ultrasound on me.  After he looks at the ultra sound and feels my lump, he told me that I need to do needle biopsy to know for sure what it is.  He says he worried, cuz my lump felt kinda hard.  I didn't ask too much questions eithers cuz I'm so scared to hear what he has to say.  A few days later i received a call from my doctor office, telling me that i need to schedule an appt with a breast surgeon, a week after my biopsy.  I was freaking out and asked why do i need to schedule with a breast surgeon w/o knowing the results from biopsy? She just said it just a standard precedure when you get abnormal result from a mammogram.  I asked her is there something that i need know, and Dr is hiding from me.  She  said No, we didn't hide anything from you, we won't know the result until you have biopsy done.  My doctor scared me even more.  The same day when I got home, I received a letter my radiologist saying that the result come out abnormal and i have dense breast.  Dense breast women are at higher risk for breast cancer. I was shaking and i can't even eat.    I have two young kids and i cried my eyes out every night. I will have needle biopsy test today at 4PM (06/13/13) and so cared to hear the result.  I won't know the result may 3 or 4 days later.  Dx 6/17/2013, IDC, 2cm, Stage II, Grade 3, 0/2 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Targeted Therapy 7/17/2013 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Chemotherapy 7/17/2013 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxotere (docetaxel) Surgery 12/4/2013 Lymph node removal: Right, Sentinel; Mastectomy: Right Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Feb 3, 2014 05:44PM - edited Feb 3, 2014 07:51PM by soriya123 Hello to all my firecrackers,  It just so hard to move on.  Since Thanksgiving I have this issue with weird symptoms on my left upper stomach.  So I asked my MO for scan.  I had CT scan on Jan 09.  CT scan results show spot on my liver 1.8cm.  My MO and radiologist told me not to worry about it.  My radiologist reviewed all the films, slice by slice and says nothing look like met. Radiologist said sometime CT scan over reaction pick up everything.   But cuz I am a BC patient of course need to do MRI to rule out met.  Since I still have my TE can't do MRI and my MO wants me to wait till I have my TE out.
